text:
Hi, Is there anyone who have a knowledge for the DOI feature to the specific pages?
Now I've enabled the DOI feature in the setting / email / subscription tab, and selected the 'enable for some pages only' option. And published the DOI email by clicking creating DOI email link. during the publish, I also confirmed the DOI enabled and for only some pages option. But it is not working for my side. :thinking_face:

according to this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/set-up-double-opt-in-for-emails|article>, this should be worked as the expected. but when I submit the form in the specific page that added in the list (specific DOI enabled list), but I didn't received any email. also checked in the SPAM folder, but doesn't exist.

Hi there everyone. I'm not sure if this is possible but I'm trying to get a deal ID from a workflow in a custom programmable module. is there a way to access data from a workflow in an email that is triggered by the workflow

Hi, I belive there's an intermittent bug with the drag and drop for email templates.

When I try and "Drop" any module (custom or default), there's no green line that shows where the module is being dropped. So even if I drop it anywhere, no module appears and I have to try it again. But even after trying again it doesn't work.

I also save and close the email and reopen and it still doesnt work.

Then it randomly works at a different time.

Has anyone seen this behavior before?
I've tried with Chrome and FF, and it happens to our other team members too
How do these new limits translate to transactional emails?
